nodes.name: Dachora Room Top Left Door (to Green Shaft)
Dachora Room Bottom Left Door (to Recharge)
Dachora Room Right Door (to Big Pink)

strats.name: G-Mode Screw and Overload PLMs
strats.note: Screw Attack through the bomb block wall, to instantly overload PLMs on the other side, and fall through the Speed Blocks.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Power Bomb
strats.note: Use a Power Bomb to destroy the bomb block wall.

strats.name: X-Ray Climb
strats.note: 6 screen X-Ray climb, and global Zeelas are still active even off camera.

strats.name: G-Mode Overload PLMs
strats.note: There are camera scroll blocks just below the speed blocks, so it is easy to overload PLMs by wall jumping or space jumping into them.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Overload PLMs
note: There are camera scroll blocks just below the speed blocks, so it is easy to overload PLMs by bouncing into them.
A single IBJ is slow enough at the top to overload them before Samus can hit the blocks.

strats.name: Spark from Floor
strats.note: Diagonal spark left to save health.

strats.name: Spark from Speedy Jump
strats.note: Diagonal spark left to save health.

strats.name: Dachora Room Shinespark No Etanks No HiJump
strats.note: Quickly wall jump up the right wall and shinespark up to barely get above the speed blocks without any tanks.
strats.devNote: At no etanks, the spark will always be cut short barely above the speed blocks.

strats.name: G-Mode Overload PLMs
strats.note: There are camera scroll blocks just below the speed blocks, so it is easy to overload PLMs by wall jumping or space jumping into them.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Overload PLMs
note: There are camera scroll blocks just below the speed blocks, so it is easy to overload PLMs by bouncing into them.
A single IBJ is slow enough at the top to overload them before Samus can hit the blocks.

strats.name: G-Mode Overload PLMs
strats.note: Use The camera scroll blocks above the speed blocks and by the bomb wall to overload PLMs.

strats.name: Dachora Room Reo Zeela Stuck Moonfall
note: Use a Reo (Bee) and a Zeela to perform an 'Enemy Stuck Moonfall', clipping Samus through the Speed blocks.
Break the Bomb blocks to bring enemies over to the Speed blocks.
Have a Reo wait off camera while the Zeela walks onto the Speed blocks, then freeze the Bee just above Samus' head.
Try to freeze both enemies near the same time and start the moonfall as quickly as possible.

strats.name: G-Mode Overload PLMs
strats.note: Use The camera scroll blocks above the speed blocks and by the bomb wall to overload PLMs.

nodes.name: Big Pink Top Left Door (to Save)
Big Pink Top Right Door (to Kihunters)
Big Pink Top Middle Left Door (to Dachora Room)
Big Pink Middle Left Door (to Mission Impossible Top)
Big Pink Bottom Middle Left Door (from Mission Impossible Bottom)
nodes.note: Samus is considered to spawn at 14 because of the crumble blocks. This can be negated by performing a stationary spin jump when entering, allowing her to 'get back to 5'

nodes.name: Big Pink Top Middle Right Door (to Hoppers)
Big Pink Bottom Middle Right Door (to Spore Spawn Farm)
Big Pink Bottom Right Door (to Green Hill Zone)
Big Pink Bottom Left Door (to Waterway)
Missile (pink Brinstar top)
Missile (pink Brinstar bottom)
Charge Beam
Big Pink Central Junction
Big Pink X-Ray Climb Setup Junction
nodes.note: A junction used as a midpoint between 5 and 13 to express that a tech is required to access 5

nodes.name: G-Mode Morph Junction (Middle Right)
nodes.note: Represents being on the second platform coming out of the right wall above the door to the Pink Hopper Room. This is below the floating platform by the Grapple blocks.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Overload PLMs with Power Bombs and Spring Ball
note: Roll through the camera scroll blocks and then through the bomb block.
Avoiding the Sidehoppers can be tricky.
Continue through the room to the Sidehoppers below the Grapple blocks, and carefully kill both of them with a single Power Bomb.
Bounce up through the crumble blocks to the door to the left

strats.name: G-mode Morph Overload PLMs with Power Bombs and Spring Ball, Break Power Bomb Blocks
note: Roll through the camera scroll blocks and then through the bomb block.
Avoiding the Sidehoppers can be tricky.
Continue through the room to the Sidehoppers below the Grapple blocks, and carefully kill both of them with a single Power Bomb.
Bounce up through the crumble blocks to the door to the left
Use a Power Bomb then quickly exit G-Mode before it explodes to also break the blocks.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Overload PLMs with Power Bombs
note: Roll through the camera scroll blocks and then through the bomb block.
Avoiding the Sidehoppers can be tricky.
Carefully roll through the rest of the room and through the bomb blocks to the lowest item.
strats.devNote: With Morph, Bombs, or Spring Ball, 1->15->12 will be used instead.

strats.name: G-mode Morph
strats.note: Roll through the camera scroll blocks and then through the bomb block.

strats.name: G-mode Morph
note: Roll through the camera scroll blocks and then through the bomb block.
Avoiding the hoppers can be tricky.

strats.name: G-mode Morph
strats.note: Roll through the camera scroll blocks and then through the bomb block.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Overload PLMs with Power Bombs and Spring Ball
note: Overload PLMs using the camera scroll blocks in front of the bomb blocks to the top left door.
Avoiding the Sidehoppers can be tricky.
Continue through the room to the Sidehoppers below the Grapple blocks, and carefully kill both of them with a single Power Bomb.
Bounce up through the crumble blocks to the door to the left

strats.name: G-mode Morph Overload PLMs with Power Bombs and Spring Ball, Break Power Bomb Blocks
note: Overload PLMs using the camera scroll blocks in front of the bomb blocks to the top left door.
Avoiding the Sidehoppers can be tricky.
Continue through the room to the Sidehoppers below the Grapple blocks, and carefully kill both of them with a single Power Bomb.
Bounce up through the crumble blocks to the door to the left
Use a Power Bomb then quickly exit G-Mode before it explodes to also break the blocks.

strats.name: G-mode Morph with Power Bombs and Overload PLMs
note: Use a Power Bomb to boost horizontally to the Morph tunnel to the left and overload PLMs using the camera scroll blocks in front of the bomb blocks.
Carefully roll through the rest of the room and through the bomb blocks to the lowest item.
strats.devNote: With Morph, Bombs, or Spring Ball, 1->15->12 will be used instead.

strats.name: G-mode Morph
strats.note: Avoiding the hoppers can be tricky.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Power Bomb
strats.note: Use a Power Bomb, then exit G-Mode.

strats.name: Big Pink Left-Side X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 1 screen.
devNote: Normally, an XRayClimb's resetRoom has mustStayPut true, but because node 5 is configured to spawn at 14, Samus will be expected to visit 14 before 5 when setting up.
This is a technicality based on the spawnAt at 14, since in reality Samus just gets doorstuck at 5 immediately in this scenario.
It's also possible to X-Ray Climb to 13, but that's reachable for free just by falling down the crumble blocks anyway.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Overload PLMs
strats.note: Overload PLMs by moving through the camera scroll blocks in front of the passageway leading to the exit of Spore Spawn Supers.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Direct Overload PLMs by Moving Through Missile Item
strats.note: Carefully roll off of the edge and land on the platform holding the item. Roll through it until PLMs are overloaded, then roll through the bomb blocks and down below.

strats.name: G-mode Morph
strats.note: If using Bombs, lure and kill the Reo. If using Spring Ball, it's important to release jump before reaching to peak of each jump to outrun the Reo.

strats.name: Speedball
strats.note: Quickly jump and precisely shoot the super block and in the same motion take out the bomb blocks with a speedball.

strats.name: Temporary Blue Chain with Springball Bounce
note: Position Samus next to the Super block, while keeping the speed effect with a Temporary Blue Chain, and break it.
Then bounce into the morph tunnel, while keeping speed, and continuing all the way through with SpringBall
Avoiding the Temporary Blue Chain is possible, but harder.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Overload PLMs with Power Bombs and Spring Ball
note: While using multiple Power Bomb boost Spring Ball jumps, to climb the room,
overload PLMs by moving through the camera scroll blocks in front of the passageway leading to the exit of Spore Spawn Supers.
Note that one Power Bomb can be saved by carefully jumping out of this morph passageway.
Kill or carefully dodge the Sidehoppers at the top, then Power Bomb boost Spring Ball jump up to the top left door and exit G-Mode.
strats.devNote: With Morph, Bombs, or Spring Ball + HiJump, 8->15->1 will be used instead.

strats.name: G-mode Morph with Power Bombs and Spring Ball
note: While using multiple Power Bomb boost Spring Ball jumps, to climb the room,
overload PLMs by moving through the camera scroll blocks in front of the passageway leading to the exit of Spore Spawn Supers.
Carefully dodge the Reos to the left of the door leading to the Pink Hopper Room and lure them and the Sidehoppers close to each other.
Place a Power Bomb to kill them and both Sidehoppers above.
Get into the Sidehopper pit and jump up and into the tunnel and go through the crumble blocks to the door to the left.
strats.devNote: With Morph, Bombs, or Spring Ball + HiJump, 8->15->4 will be used instead.

strats.name: G-mode Morph with Power Bombs and Spring Ball, Break Power Bomb Blocks
note: While using multiple Power Bomb boost Spring Ball jumps, to climb the room,
overload PLMs by moving through the camera scroll blocks in front of the passageway leading to the exit of Spore Spawn Supers.
Carefully dodge the Reos to the left of the door leading to the Pink Hopper Room and lure them and the Sidehoppers close to each other.
Place a Power Bomb to kill them and both Sidehoppers above.
Get into the Sidehopper pit and jump up and into the tunnel and go through the crumble blocks to the door to the left.
Use a Power Bomb then quickly exit G-Mode before it explodes to also break the blocks.
strats.devNote: With Morph, Bombs, or Spring Ball + HiJump, 8->15->4 will be used instead.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Overload PLMs
strats.note: Overload PLMs by moving through the camera scroll blocks in front of the passageway leading to the exit of Spore Spawn Supers.
strats.devNote: Using a Power Bomb boost into Spring Ball will not work, as it will make the blocks remain solid.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Direct Overload PLMs by Moving Through Missile Item
strats.note: Roll through it until PLMs are overloaded, then roll through the bomb blocks and down below.
strats.devNote: With more items, the strat with camera scroll blocks will be used.

strats.name: Big Pink Right-Side X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 1 screen.

strats.name: G-mode with Crystal Flash Clip and Overloading PLMs
note: Go into the morph tunnel below the Charge Beam location and Crystal Flash to force a standup and jump through.
Samus is now unable to use X-Ray. Overload PLMs using the camera scroll blocks on the path upward, then go through the bomb blocks.
Go up to the Sidehopper pit and go up through the crumble blocks and through to the next room.
strats.devNote: This is only useful to save a wall jump.

strats.name: G-mode with Crystal Flash Clip
note: Go into the morph tunnel below the Charge Beam location and Crystal Flash to force a standup and jump through.
Samus is now unable to use X-Ray. Without Morph, be careful not to overload PLMs using the camera scroll blocks on the path upward.
Then partially floor clip into the left side of the bomb block, and jump to clip through and escape.
To exit G-Mode, damage down until the reserves trigger, which can be done most quickly using the Sidehoppers.
strats.devNote: This assumes Samus has many Energy Tanks, which will take a while to empty.

strats.name: Charge Escape Clip
strats.note: Partially floor clip into the left side of the bomb block above the charge beam location. Then jump to clip through the above tile.

strats.name: Speedball
note: Jump over the bug pipe while blue and roll into the morph tunnel to break the bomb block.
Shortcharge too much and the jump will not be able to reach the morph tunnel.

strats.name: Temporary Blue with SpringBall Bounce
note: Build a ShineCharge on the below platform and bring it up to the morph tunnel by chaining Temporary Blue.
Aim to bounce into the tunnel opening and use springball to bounce the rest of the way while blue.

strats.name: Big Pink Return Through Crumble Blocks
strats.note: The Crumble Block next to the Power Bomb Blocks does not respawn, so it's possible to enter from this door, grab the items, and return without breaking the Power Bomb blocks.

strats.name: Big Pink Wall Ice Clip the Mission Impossible Crumble Blocks
note: Freeze a Zeb inside of the crumble blocks below the entrance to the Power Bomb room and use it to get stuck inside the crumble blocks, breaking them.
Repeatedly freeze a left facing Zeb from the enemy spawner lower in the room.
Freeze it close to the right side of the crumble block so that Samus will attach to the enemy when rolling into it.
Finally, jump with Bombs or SpringBall to break the crumble block.

strats.name: Big Pink Reo Ice Clip
note: Lure the Reo (Bee) to the left to use it as a platform for ice clipping up through the crumbles to the Power Bomb room exit door.
Watch the Reo bounce against the left wall until it does a slow hover towards Samus.
There is a very small timing of when its right claw is above the small pale spore next to the big red spore, when Samus should jump to be above the Reo.
Positioning Samus' front toe beneath this spore (facing left) will cause the bee to fly with the correct timing after Samus takes knockback damage, with a 3 pixel window.
This will cause it to fly left and into the two tile gap below the crumble blocks.
Freeze it once to get above it, and then again for the ice clip.
Once it is up there, the bee will become stuck and the room will need to be reset.
But if the Reo does not fit in the hole, it is possible to just wait near the ledge for another slow hover to try again.

strats.name: Big Pink Zeb Ice Clip
note: Raise a Zeb to be just below the crumble blocks and blindly freeze it to set up an ice clip to reach the Power Bomb room exit door.
Get a bug from the pipe to spawn facing left and freeze it while moving to the ledge below the Hopper room door.
While crouched, a spazer or wave beam shot will shoot through the floor in front of Samus.
The bug must be frozen at a height between where Samus is crouched and where she is standing.
Once frozen, somehow track how long until the freeze effect expires, and when the bug will reach the crumble blocks.
If the bug is off camera when not frozen, it will despawn.
Refreeze the Zeb below the crumble blocks and ice clip up to reach the door.

strats.name: Return Through Broken Super Block
strats.devNote: This base strat represents only backtracking after entering from 7.

strats.name: Big Pink Off Screen Super Block
note: Break the bomb blocks then shoot a super into the morph tunnel to break the super block off screen.
Requires pixel precision, although there are several pixels that work. The camera must be fully scrolled to the right, which may require going far left and back.

strats.name: Big Pink Crystal Flash Standup - Super Block
strats.note: Crystal Flash in the morph tunnel to force a standup, making it possible to shoot the super block from the left while it's on-screen.

strats.name: Big Pink Speedball Jump into Raised Bomb Blocks
strats.note: Break the bomb blocks by jumping into them with speed. These is more easily done at low run speed.

strats.name: Big Pink Temporary Blue Bounce into Raised Bomb Blocks
strats.note: Stop with Temporary Blue in front of the bomb blocks then jump and bounce into the morph tunnel to clear them.

strats.name: Guide Enemy to Grapple Blocks
note: Lead an enemy through parts of the room as a way to reach the Mission Impossible missile location.
The respawning Zeb can be used by carfeully keeping it on camera and staying high enough that it does not attack.
Wait for it to respawn before attempting to guide it.
Or a Reo can be brought up to this section of room, but sometimes gets stuck on the way.
strats.devNote: This is just to avoid walljumping.

strats.name: Zeb Farm
strats.devNote: FIXME: Other nodes could be used to reset the room, with additional requirements.

strats.name: Retroactive X-Ray Setup
strats.note: The only expected way for Samus to access 5 is to enter room while doing a stationary spinjump, otherwise she is expected to spawn at 14 and fall to 13.

strats.name: G-mode Morph
note: Carefully dodge the Sidehoppers, or kill them with a Power Bomb. Be careful not to hit the bomb block with the Power Bomb or it will remain solid.
With IBJ alone, it is easiest to IBJ from the bug pipe below to the ceiling, luring the Sidehoppers to the left.
At the top, overload PLMs using the camera scroll block just in front of the block, then roll through it.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Overload PLMs with Power Bombs and Spring Ball
note: Go down and overload PLMs by moving through the camera scroll blocks in front of the passageway leading to the exit of Spore Spawn Supers.
Use multiple Power Bomb boost Spring Ball jumps, to climb the room; note that one Power Bomb can be saved by carefully jumping out of this morph passageway.
Kill or carefully dodge the Sidehoppers at the top, then Power Bomb boost Spring Ball jump up to the top left door and exit G-Mode.

strats.name: G-mode Overload PLMs with Morph
note: Overload PLMs by moving through the camera scroll blocks in front of the passageway leading to the exit of Spore Spawn Supers,
or in front of the bomb block at the top left door. Safely kill the enemies, then mid-air morph and go through the crumble blocks.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Overload PLMs with Bombs
note: If there are no Sidehoppers in the bottom right corner of their pen, roll down and carefully place bombs while luring and killing them.
Otherwise, go down into the hallway below and carefully kill the two Reos and lure the Sidehoppers to the left.
If they don't stay on the left, exit this hallway and enter it again to reset the camera and try again.
Go up through the crumble blocks to the left. If PLMs are not yet overloaded, place Bombs next to the crumble blocks.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Overload PLMs with Bombs, Break Power Bomb Blocks
note: If there are no Sidehoppers in the bottom right corner of their pen, roll down and carefully place bombs while luring and killing them.
Otherwise, go down into the hallway below and carefully kill the two Reos and lure the Sidehoppers to the left.
If they don't stay on the left, exit this hallway and enter it again to reset the camera and try again.
Go up through the crumble blocks to the left. If PLMs are not yet overloaded, place Bombs next to the crumble blocks.
Use a Power Bomb then quickly exit G-Mode before it explodes to also break the blocks.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Overload PLMs with Power Bombs and Spring Ball
note: Carefully dodge the Reos to the left of the door leading to the Pink Hopper Room and lure them and the Sidehoppers close to each other.
Place a Power Bomb to kill them and both Sidehoppers above. Go down below and lure the third Reo, below the Zeb pipe, off screen to the left.
Overload PLMs by moving through the camera scroll blocks in front of the passageway leading to the exit of Spore Spawn Supers.
Either carefully jump out of this morph tunnel or use a Power Bomb boost Spring Ball jump to get up to the ledge.
Get into the Sidehopper pit and jump up and into the tunnel and go through the crumble blocks to the door to the left.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Overload PLMs with Power Bombs and Spring Ball, Break Power Bomb Blocks
note: Carefully dodge the Reos to the left of the door leading to the Pink Hopper Room and lure them and the Sidehoppers close to each other.
Place a Power Bomb to kill them and both Sidehoppers above. Go down below and lure the third Reo, below the Zeb pipe, off screen to the left.
Overload PLMs by moving through the camera scroll blocks in front of the passageway leading to the exit of Spore Spawn Supers.
Either carefully jump out of this morph tunnel or use a Power Bomb boost Spring Ball jump to get up to the ledge.
Get into the Sidehopper pit and jump up and into the tunnel and go through the crumble blocks to the door to the left.
Use a Power Bomb then quickly exit G-Mode before it explodes to also break the blocks.

strats.name: G-mode Morph with Bombs
note: If there are no Sidehoppers in the bottom right corner of their pen, roll down and carefully place bombs while luring and killing them.
Otherwise, go down into the hallway below and carefully kill the two Reos and lure the Sidehoppers to the left.
If they don't stay on the left, exit this hallway and enter it again to reset the camera and try again. Then IBJ up to the item above.
strats.devNote: An equivalent strat with using a Power Bomb isn't needed as it is the same requirements as getting to 4 with the blocks broken.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Overload PLMs
strats.note: Overload PLMs by moving through the camera scroll blocks in front of the passageway leading to the exit of Spore Spawn Supers.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Power Bomb the Blocks
note: Use a Power Bomb to kill any Sidehoppers in the pit below, then roll off and use a second, while exiting G-Mode to destroy the blocks in front of the door.
Place the Power Bomb far enough left to hit the blocks, but not so far as to lure the Sidehopper.
This is when Samus is on the right-most squiggly plant, or when there is one tile of air between the right wall and the edge of the screen.

nodes.name: Mission Impossible Top Right Door (to Big Pink Upper)
Mission Impossible Bottom Right Door (to Big Pink Lower)
Power Bomb (pink Brinstar)
Mission Impossible Top Left Junction
nodes.note: The top left section of the room, where the Super block is

strats.name: Tank the Damage while Running Through
note: 2 hits are expected to be taken.
The first can be either from a Sidehopper or from a spike.
Second hit will be from a Sidehopper.
It is possible to avoid the first hit by opening the door and standing in the doorway while killing the first hopper.

strats.name: Morph Power Beam Sidehopper Kill
strats.note: Morph reduces damage because the ceiling Sidehopper can't reach a Morphed Samus.

strats.name: Intermediate Weapon Sidehopper Kill
strats.note: Pseudo Screw can help with the Sidehopper kills.

strats.name: Morph Intermediate Weapon Sidehopper Kill
strats.note: Morph reduces damage because the ceiling Sidehopper can't reach a morphed Samus.

strats.name: Safe Weapon Sidehopper Kill
strats.note: All beam weapons that can take out a Sidehopper in 5 hits or less can reliably take out the Sidehoppers damage-free.

strats.name: Doorway Sidehopper Kill
note: Open the door and kill the first hopper from inside the doorway. It won't be able to hit Samus for many jumps.
It is possible to quickly get back to the right and crouch against the the ledge while aiming upward to safely kill the Sidehopper.
Alternatively, morph can help with the second hopper, as it won't be able to hit Samus.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Power Bomb Kill
strats.note: Use 1-3 Power Bombs to kill the Sidehoppers.

strats.name: Pink Brinstar Power Bombs X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 1 screen.

strats.name: Pink Brinstar Power Bombs Crystal Flash Clip
note: Perform the crystal flash all the way to the left, against the crumble blocks to prevent the elevator on the right from blocking you in.
Simply jump after performing the crystal flash to jump through the floor.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Overload PLMs with Bombs
strats.note: Place Power Bombs against the side of the crumble block until PLMs are overloaded, then go through.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Direct Overload PLMs with Power Bombs
strats.note: Place two Power Bombs, precisely on the third tile in the morph tunnel to overload PLMs (watch the right side of the screen).
devNote: Because of the gates, it costs 2 Power Bombs to get into the tunnel and 2 to get out the other side.
There is no canRiskPermanentLossOfAccess, because there is no reason to go here except to get the item and leave.

strats.name: Mission Impossible

failures.name: Crumble Failure
failures.note: Failure leaves you at 3 with a solid crumble block above.

note: This involves doing a quick-drop through the Crumble block, grabbing the item, and jumping back up before the crumble block reappears.
Mission Impossible expects that the Sidehoppers are dead. To avoid redundant requirements, they must be killed coming in.

strats.name: Base
strats.devNote: This link is only useful after Mission Impossible, which already requires the hoppers to be killed.

nodes.name: Pink Brinstar Hoppers Left Door (to Big Pink)
Pink Brinstar Hoppers Right Door (to E-Tank)

strats.name: Power Beam Kill
note: This assumes you don't know you're entering this room, and take a Small Sidehopper hit quickly.
The Small Sidehoppers may deliver more of the hits, but this is an assumed worst case scenario

strats.name: Intermediate Weapon Kill
strats.note: This assumes you don't know you're entering this room, and take a Small Sidehopper hit quickly.

strats.name: Fast Weapon Kill
strats.note: This assumes you don't know you're entering this room, and take a Small Sidehopper hit quickly.

strats.name: Kill on Entry
strats.note: Although there are other ways to kill them on entry, these are done reliably.

strats.name: Pink Hopper Reverse Gate Glitch
note: This strat involves shooting a Super diagonally from the correct height while flush against the left wall.
Its acceleration will cause it to clip into the blue gate off-screen.
strats.devNote: The reverse gate glitch pretty much requires killing the enemies first, so it's required here.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Indirect to Despawn Gate Power Bomb Kill
strats.note: Kill the Sidehoppers with a Power Bomb upon entry.
strats.devNote: A Power Bomb strat could be included to just kill the Sidehoppers, but it only saves a little energy since you'll need Wave or Supers for the gate.

strats.name: Base
strats.devNote: The reverse gate glitch may be executed earlier from node 1 -> 1.

strats.name: Speedy Jump Onto Grapple Block
strats.note: Run from the left side to the right, then jump just before or at the end of the runway to get up onto the Grapple block.

strats.name: Spring Ball from the Doorframe
strats.note: Perform a very precise maximum height Spring Ball jump from the doorframe onto the Grapple block.

strats.name: IBJ
devNote: IBJ requires the enemies to be killed
The reverse gate glitch may be executed earlier from node 1 -> 1.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph IBJ
strats.note: Kill the Sidehoppers with Bombs or a Power Bomb, then IBJ up onto the Grapple block. Use Wave to get through.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Indirect to Despawn Gate with IBJ
strats.note: Kill the Sidehoppers with Bombs or a Power Bomb, then IBJ up onto the Grapple block.

strats.name: Elevator with Power Bombs
strats.note: Using a power bomb against the left wall will kill the enemies and trigger the elevator.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Elevator with Power Bomb
strats.note: Using a power bomb against the left wall will kill the enemies and trigger the elevator.

strats.name: Safe Kill
strats.note: With access to the right side of the room, it's possible to kill the enemies safely with Wave or a PB or screw attack once on the other side.

nodes.name: Hopper E-Tank Door (to Hoppers)
Energy Tank, Brinstar Gate
Spore Spawn Supers Top Left Door (to Spore Spawn)
Spore Spawn Supers Bottom Left Door (to Farming Room)
Super Missile (pink Brinstar)

strats.name: X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 8 screens.

strats.name: G-Mode Overload PLMS with Camera Scroll Blocks
strats.note: Climb the shaft and overload PLMs with the camera scroll blocks which are against the crumble blocks.
devNote: This is mostly an alternative to the canBeVeryPatient X-Ray climb.
This is possible with an IBJ, but it's still about 3 minutes, and you can't remotely acquire the item because it's in a Chozo Ball.

nodes.name: Spore Spawn Farming Room Left Door (to Big Pink)
Spore Spawn Farming Room Right Door (to Supers)
Waterway Door (to Big Pink)
Energy Tank, Waterway

strats.name: Zero Farm
devNote: FIXME: The h_heatProof requirement is because Zeros only drop small energy, not enough to guarantee progress if the neighboring room is heated
Later we should remove this in favor of some way to require that the neighboring room is not heated.

strats.name: Suitless Spark with Space Jump
strats.note: Doable without a short charge, since there are 32 tiles (plus one open end) to charge it.

strats.name: Suitless Spark
strats.note: Doable without a short charge, since there are 32 tiles (plus one open end) to charge it.

strats.name: Frozen Caterpillar
note: Watch a Zero (Caterpillar) climb along the ceiling before knocking it down near the speed blocks.
Freeze it and jump on top.  Escape the water with a spinjump or crouch jump.

strats.name: Shinespark Come in Charged
strats.note: Doable without a wall jump if Samus comes in charged.

strats.name: Speedball
note: Roll through the whole room breaking the speedblocks.
The fish enemies will die but some puyos will remain.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: Speed blocks are ignored here because it's impossible to reach node 2 without breaking them.

nodes.name: Dachora Energy Refill Door (to Dachora Room)
Dachora Energy Refill
Big Pink Save Room Door (to Big Pink)
Big Pink Save Station
